channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: StyleID: Identity Disentanglement for Anonymizing Faces
item.description: Privacy of machine learning models is one of the remaining challenges that hinder the broad adoption of Artificial Intelligent (AI).

item.title: TiG-BEV: Multi-view BEV 3D Object Detection via Target Inner-Geometry Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose the learning scheme of Target Inner-Geometry from the LiDAR modality into camera-based BEV detectors for both dense depth and BEV features, termed as TiG-BEV.

item.title: Explainable and Lightweight Model for COVID-19 Detection Using Chest Radiology Images
item.description: Deep learning (DL) analysis of Chest X-ray (CXR) and Computed tomography (CT) images has garnered a lot of attention in recent times due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Evaluating Generalizability of Deep Learning Models Using Indian-COVID-19 CT Dataset
item.description: One of the major concerns in using ma-chine learning (ML) approaches for automatic processing of CT scan images in clinical setting is that these methods are trained on limited and biased sub-sets of publicly available COVID-19 data.

item.title: SynCLay: Interactive Synthesis of Histology Images from Bespoke Cellular Layouts
item.description: Tissue image generation based on bespoke cellular layouts through the proposed framework allows users to generate different histological patterns from arbitrary topological arrangement of different types of cells.

item.title: Part-guided Relational Transformers for Fine-grained Visual Recognition
item.description: This framework, namely PArt-guided Relational Transformers (PART), is proposed to learn the discriminative part features with an automatic part discovery module, and to explore the intrinsic correlations with a feature transformation module by adapting the Transformer models from the field of natural language processing.

item.title: A Clustering-guided Contrastive Fusion for Multi-view Representation Learning
item.description: To this end, we utilize a deep fusion network to fuse view-specific representations into the view-common representation, extracting high-level semantics for obtaining robust representation.

item.title: Anxolotl, an Anxiety Companion App -- Stress Detection
item.description: Stress has a great effect on people's lives that can not be understated.

item.title: Cramming: Training a Language Model on a Single GPU in One Day
item.description: Recent trends in language modeling have focused on increasing performance through scaling, and have resulted in an environment where training language models is out of reach for most researchers and practitioners.

item.title: Feature learning in neural networks and kernel machines that recursively learn features
item.description: In this work, we isolate the key mechanism driving feature learning in fully connected neural networks by connecting neural feature learning to the average gradient outer product.

item.title: Learning to Detect Noisy Labels Using Model-Based Features
item.description: Label noise is ubiquitous in various machine learning scenarios such as self-labeling with model predictions and erroneous data annotation.

item.title: Heterogeneous Graph Contrastive Learning with Meta-path Contexts and Weighted Negative Samples
item.description: We take node embeddings in the coarse view as anchors, and construct positive and negative samples from the fine-grained view.

item.title: Shape-Aware Fine-Grained Classification of Erythroid Cells
item.description: BMEC contains 5, 666 images of individual erythroid cells, each of which is extracted from the bone marrow erythroid cell smears and professionally annotated to one of the four types of erythroid cells.

item.title: End-to-End Modeling Hierarchical Time Series Using Autoregressive Transformer and Conditional Normalizing Flow based Reconciliation
item.description: Multivariate time series forecasting with hierarchical structure is pervasive in real-world applications, demanding not only predicting each level of the hierarchy, but also reconciling all forecasts to ensure coherency, i. e., the forecasts should satisfy the hierarchical aggregation constraints.

item.title: Automatic Recognition and Classification of Future Work Sentences from Academic Articles in a Specific Domain
item.description: This paper presents methods to automatically extract FWS from academic papers and classify them according to the different future directions embodied in the paper's content.

item.title: Lexicographic Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this work we introduce reinforcement learning techniques for solving lexicographic multi-objective problems.

item.title: MVTN: Learning Multi-View Transformations for 3D Understanding
item.description: Multi-view projection techniques have shown themselves to be highly effective in achieving top-performing results in the recognition of 3D shapes.

item.title: DeepCuts: Single-Shot Interpretability based Pruning for BERT
item.description: We also analyze our pruning masks and find them to be significantly different from the ones obtained using standard metrics.

item.title: The Forward-Forward Algorithm: Some Preliminary Investigations
item.description: The aim of this paper is to introduce a new learning procedure for neural networks and to demonstrate that it works well enough on a few small problems to be worth further investigation.

item.title: AER: Auto-Encoder with Regression for Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: We then propose AER (Auto-encoder with Regression), a joint model that combines a vanilla auto-encoder and an LSTM regressor to incorporate the successes and address the limitations of each method.

item.title: From Single-Visit to Multi-Visit Image-Based Models: Single-Visit Models are Enough to Predict Obstructive Hydronephrosis
item.description: Previous work has shown the potential of deep learning to predict renal obstruction using kidney ultrasound images.

item.title: Co-supervised learning paradigm with conditional generative adversarial networks for sample-efficient classification
item.description: Classification using supervised learning requires annotating a large amount of classes-balanced data for model training and testing.

item.title: Variance Reduction for Score Functions Using Optimal Baselines
item.description: Although we show that there exist examples where the optimal baseline may be arbitrarily better than a value function baseline, we find that the value function baseline usually performs similarly to an optimal baseline in terms of variance reduction.

item.title: Cross-Resolution Flow Propagation for Foveated Video Super-Resolution
item.description: We propose Cross-Resolution Flow Propagation (CRFP) for FVSR.

item.title: NeRN -- Learning Neural Representations for Neural Networks
item.description: Neural Representations have recently been shown to effectively reconstruct a wide range of signals from 3D meshes and shapes to images and videos.

item.title: Infusing Definiteness into Randomness: Rethinking Composition Styles for Deep Image Matting
item.description: Inspired by this, we introduce a novel composition style that binds the source and combined foregrounds in a definite triplet.

item.title: Noise-aware Learning from Web-crawled Image-Text Data for Image Captioning
item.description: While the filtering strategy can effectively remove noisy data, however, it leads to a decrease in learnable knowledge and sometimes brings about a new problem of data deficiency.

item.title: A Generalization of ViT/MLP-Mixer to Graphs
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have shown great potential in the field of graph representation learning.

item.title: Deep Learning Models for River Classification at Sub-Meter Resolutions from Multispectral and Panchromatic Commercial Satellite Imagery
item.description: In a novel approach, we then use results from the multispectral model to generate training data for FCN that only require panchromatic imagery, of which considerably more is available.

item.title: MultiSpider: Towards Benchmarking Multilingual Text-to-SQL Semantic Parsing
item.description: Text-to-SQL semantic parsing is an important NLP task, which greatly facilitates the interaction between users and the database and becomes the key component in many human-computer interaction systems.

item.title: Strangeness-driven Exploration in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Efficient exploration strategy is one of essential issues in cooperative multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) algorithms requiring complex coordination.

item.title: Quantile Risk Control: A Flexible Framework for Bounding the Probability of High-Loss Predictions
item.description: In this work, we propose a flexible framework to produce a family of bounds on quantiles of the loss distribution incurred by a predictor.

item.title: DAE-Former: Dual Attention-guided Efficient Transformer for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Transformers have recently gained attention in the computer vision domain due to their ability to model long-range dependencies.

item.title: Improving Complex Knowledge Base Question Answering via Question-to-Action and Question-to-Question Alignment
item.description: Complex knowledge base question answering can be achieved by converting questions into sequences of predefined actions.

item.title: Orientation-Shared Convolution Representation for CT Metal Artifact Learning
item.description: During X-ray computed tomography (CT) scanning, metallic implants carrying with patients often lead to adverse artifacts in the captured CT images and then impair the clinical treatment.

item.title: Simultaneously Optimizing Perturbations and Positions for Black-box Adversarial Patch Attacks
item.description: Extensive experiments are conducted on the Face Recognition (FR) task, and results on four representative FR models show that our method can significantly improve the attack success rate and query efficiency.

item.title: SMMix: Self-Motivated Image Mixing for Vision Transformers
item.description: Due to the subtle designs of the self-motivated paradigm, our SMMix is significant in its smaller training overhead and better performance than other CutMix variants.

item.title: Unsupervised Representation Learning from Pre-trained Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: These imply that the gap corresponds to the lost information of the image, and we can reconstruct the image by filling the gap.

item.title: Fewer is More: Efficient Object Detection in Large Aerial Images
item.description: Current mainstream object detection methods for large aerial images usually divide large images into patches and then exhaustively detect the objects of interest on all patches, no matter whether there exist objects or not.

item.title: Link-level simulator for 5G localization
item.description: Channel-state-information-based localization in 5G networks has been a promising way to obtain highly accurate positions compared to previous communication networks.

item.title: A Novel Self-Supervised Learning-Based Anomaly Node Detection Method Based on an Autoencoder in Wireless Sensor Networks
item.description: Due to the issue that existing wireless sensor network (WSN)-based anomaly detection methods only consider and analyze temporal features, in this paper, a self-supervised learning-based anomaly node detection method based on an autoencoder is designed.

item.title: Saliency-Augmented Memory Completion for Continual Learning
item.description: Specifically, we innovatively propose to store the part of the image most important to the tasks in episodic memory by saliency map extraction and memory encoding.

item.title: Improved Kernel Alignment Regret Bound for Online Kernel Learning
item.description: If the eigenvalues of the kernel matrix decay exponentially, then our algorithm enjoys a regret of $O(\sqrt{\mathcal{A}_T})$ at a computational complexity of $O(\ln^2{T})$.

item.title: Learning Generalizable Representations for Reinforcement Learning via Adaptive Meta-learner of Behavioral Similarities
item.description: How to learn an effective reinforcement learning-based model for control tasks from high-level visual observations is a practical and challenging problem.

item.title: Skit-S2I: An Indian Accented Speech to Intent dataset
item.description: Conventional conversation assistants extract text transcripts from the speech signal using automatic speech recognition (ASR) and then predict intent from the transcriptions.

item.title: TextBox 2.0: A Text Generation Library with Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: To facilitate research on text generation, this paper presents a comprehensive and unified library, TextBox 2. 0, focusing on the use of pre-trained language models (PLMs).

item.title: Closed-form control with spike coding networks
item.description: The neuroscience theory of Spike Coding Networks (SCNs) offers a fully analytical solution for implementing dynamical systems in recurrent spiking neural networks -- while maintaining irregular, sparse, and robust spiking activity -- but it's not clear how to directly apply it to control problems.

item.title: GAE-ISumm: Unsupervised Graph-Based Summarization of Indian Languages
item.description: Further, we experiment with the most publicly available Indian language summarization datasets to investigate the effectiveness of GAE-ISumm on other Indian languages.

item.title: Weakly-Supervised Deep Learning Model for Prostate Cancer Diagnosis and Gleason Grading of Histopathology Images
item.description: One of the prognostic features in prostate cancer is the Gleason grading of histopathology images.

item.title: Explainable AI for Bioinformatics: Methods, Tools, and Applications
item.description: Explainable artificial intelligence (XAI) is an emerging field that aims to mitigate the opaqueness of black-box models and make it possible to interpret how AI systems make their decisions with transparency.
